<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
With EndpointSlice feature enabled, after EndpointSliceController creates or updates an EndpointSlice when reconciling a Service, the Service would always be processed one extra time, which is triggered by the EndpointSlice added/updated event made by itself during the first processing. 
```
I0210 13:22:40.286353       1 endpointslice_controller.go:292] About to update endpoint slices for service "default/nginx"
I0210 13:22:40.291017       1 endpointslice_controller.go:267] Finished syncing service "default/nginx" endpoint slices. (4.664274ms)
I0210 13:22:40.292050       1 endpointslice_controller.go:292] About to update endpoint slices for service "default/nginx"
I0210 13:22:40.292962       1 endpointslice_controller.go:267] Finished syncing service "default/nginx" endpoint slices. (914.925us)
```

**What you expected to happen**:
EndpointSliceController shouldn't reprocess a Service due to the EndpointSlice update made by itself.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Enable EndpointSlice feature, improve kube-controller-manager log to 5.
2. Create a nginx deployment
3. Create a Service backed by the above deployment.
4. Check kube-controller-manager log: the service will be processed twice in succession.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
It's because EndpointSliceController tracks stale resource version after creating/updating an EndpointSlice.
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/acd97b42f3acb09ffa30c60690637e815ef28b0a/pkg/controller/endpointslice/reconciler.go#L217
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/acd97b42f3acb09ffa30c60690637e815ef28b0a/pkg/controller/endpointslice/reconciler.go#L228
